meanings.definition: The quality or state of being uppish or arrogant.
meanings.sent1: Her constant uppishnesses made it difficult for others to approach her.
meanings.sent2: His uppishnesses at the party offended many guests.
meanings.sent3: The cat's uppishnesses towards the dog were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The uppishnesses of the storm clouds warned of an impending downpour.
meanings.sent5: The uppishnesses of the queen bee kept the other bees in line.

meanings.definition: An instance of behaving in an arrogant or haughty manner.
meanings.sent1: After her uppishnesses at the meeting, no one wanted to work with her.
meanings.sent2: His uppishnesses during the game caused tension among the players.
meanings.sent3: The uppishnesses of the squirrel as it stole the bird's food was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The uppishnesses of the old tree towering over the forest was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The uppishnesses of the peacock as it strutted around the garden caught everyone's attention.
